data.text:
1973-74 Pittsburgh Penguins Roster

1973-74 Pittsburgh Penguins Statistics

1973-74 Pittsburgh Penguins Results

The Pittsburgh Penguins of the National Hockey League ended the 1973-74 season with a record of 28 wins and 41 losses and 9 ties for 65 points, finishing fifth in the NHL's West Division.

The Penguins scored 242 goals and surrendered 273. Lowell MacDonald netted 43 goals for Pittsburgh, while Jean Pronovost tallied 30 or more also. Syl Apps recorded 61 assists. Andy Brown topped the squad with 13 wins and a team-best 3.53 goals against average, pacing goaltenders with enough qualifying appearances.

Ken Schinkel and Marc Boileau coached the team.

Click on column headings to sort.
